title: Elementary Latin
description: Lecture, three hours; discussion, two hours. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Elementary Latin for Graduate Students
description: Lecture, eight hours. Concurrently scheduled with course 14. No grading.

title: Elementary Latin
description: Lecture, three hours; discussion, two hours. Enforced requisite: course 1. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Elementary Latin
description: Lecture, three hours; discussion, two hours. Enforced requisite: course 2 or 14. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Elementary Latin: Intensive
description: Lecture, 10 hours. Declensions of nouns and adjectives, conjugations in indicative mood, and primary uses of subjunctive mood. Emphasis on development of ability to read easy selections of classical prose. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Intensive First-Year Latin
description: Lecture, 19 hours. Eight-week intensive introduction to Latin language equivalent to courses 1, 2, and 3. Offered in summer only. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars
description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.

title: Intermediate Latin I
description: Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour (when scheduled). Requisite: course 3 or 16. Formal review of Latin grammar and syntax and development of skills in reading original texts of Latin prose. Readings selected to introduce literature and culture of ancient Rome. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Honors Seminars
description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower-division lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Honors Contracts
description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to lower-division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.

title: Student Research Program
description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower-division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.

title: Intermediate Latin II: Readings in Latin
description: Lecture, three hours. Enforced requisite: course 20. Introduction to developing skills of reading longer, continuous passages of original Latin prose and/or poetry texts, with attention to literary and cultural background. Course is requisite to advanced reading courses. May be repeated for credit twice with change of assigned readings and with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Plautus
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Terence
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Lucretius
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Ovid
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Beginning Vergil: Selections from Aeneid I-VI
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Reading of one or more books from first half of Aeneid, designed especially for students with only limited experience in reading Latin poetry. May be repeated for credit with change in readings and consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Vergil
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 105A. Reading and discussion of Vergil’s Eclogues, Georgics, and/or second half of Aeneid. May be repeated for credit with change in readings. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Catullus
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Horace
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Roman Elegy
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Selections from Catullus, Tibullus, and Propertius. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Roman Satire
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Readings from author(s) of Roman satire, including Horace, Persius, and Juvenal, or related satiric texts. May be repeated for credit with change in readings and consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Study of Latin Prose
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Work in sight reading and grammatical analysis of classical prose texts; writing of classical prose. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Livy
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Tacitus
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Cicero: Orations
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Roman Epistolography: Cicero and Pliny
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Caesar
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Roman Novel
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Reading and discussion of either Petronius’ Satyricon or Apuleius’ Metamorphoses and development of genre of prose novel in antiquity. May be repeated for credit with change in author and text. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Sallust
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Seneca
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Selection of Seneca’s works read in Latin. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Readings in Roman Prose
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Readings of selected Roman prose author(s). Topics may vary from year to year and may be organized in terms of chronology (Republican or imperial), literary genre (Roman biography, antiquarian learning, or science), and/or theme. May be repeated for credit with topic change. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Readings in Roman Poetry
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Readings of selected Roman poetry author(s). Topics may vary from year to year and may be organized in terms of chronology (Republican or imperial), epic, lyric, elegy, and/or theme. May be repeated for credit with topic change. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Vulgate
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 3. Reading of selected chapters of St. Jerome’s translation of Bible, with emphasis on unclassical features of Latin. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Patristic Texts
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 100. Reading and discussion of one or more Latin patristic texts (especially works of Ambrose, Augustine, and/or Jerome), with emphasis on specific features of patristic, as opposed to classical, Latin. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Introduction to Postclassical Latin
description: Lecture, three hours. Basic competence in classical Latin required. Readings in postclassical Latin. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Postclassical Latin Prose
description: Lecture, three hours. Advanced readings of selected texts in postclassical Latin prose. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Postclassical Latin Poetry
description: Lecture, three hours. Advanced readings of selected texts in postclassical Latin poetry. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Honors Seminars
description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Honors Contracts
description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper-division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.

title: Individual Studies in Latin
description: Tutorial, two hours. Limited to juniors/seniors. Individual intensive study, with scheduled meetings to be arranged between faculty member and student. Assigned reading and tangible evidence of mastery of subject matter required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Directed Research in Latin
description: Tutorial, two hours. Limited to juniors/seniors. Supervised individual research or investigation under guidance of faculty mentor. Culminating paper or project required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.

title: History of Latin Literature
description: Lecture, three hours. Lectures on history of Latin literature, supplemented by reading of Latin texts in original language. May be taken independently for credit. S/U or letter grading.

title: History of Latin Literature
description: Lecture, three hours. Lectures on history of Latin literature, supplemented by reading of Latin texts in original language. May be taken independently for credit. S/U or letter grading.

title: History of Latin Literature
description: Lecture, three hours. Lectures on history of Latin literature, supplemented by reading of Latin texts in original language. May be taken independently for credit. S/U or letter grading.

title: Roman Epic Tradition
description: Seminar, three hours. Close study of one epic poet other than Vergil (e.g., Ennius, Lucan, Valerius Flaccus, Statius, Silius Italicus), with attention to literary tradition of epic. May be repeated for credit with topic change. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Catullus
description: Seminar, three hours. Detailed consideration of entire Catullan corpus. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Elegiac Poetry
description: Lecture, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Propertius
description: Lecture, three hours. Course 203A is not requisite to 203B. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Vergil's Aeneid
description: Lecture, three hours. Course 204A is requisite to 204B. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Vergil's Aeneid
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 204A. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Vergil's Bucolics
description: Seminar, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Vergil's Georgics
description: Seminar, three hours. Course 205A is not requisite to 205B. Close reading of Vergil’s text; careful evaluation of influential criticism on poem, much of it recent; examination of work’s place within tradition of rural poetry. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Horace
description: Lecture, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Roman Comedy
description: Seminar, three hours. Survey of history of Roman comedy. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Ovid
description: Seminar, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Roman Satire
description: Seminar, three hours. Detailed study of one individual satirist, with attention to his position in development of satirical genre in Roman literature. Choice of author varies from year to year. Close study of text, of characteristics of writer as social critic and artist, and of contemporary literary and social environment. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Advanced Latin Prose Composition
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 110. S/U or letter grading.

title: Seminar: Roman Historians—Sallust
description: Seminar, three hours. Study of considerable portions of writings of Sallust. May be taken independently for credit. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Roman Historians—Livy
description: Seminar, three hours. Study of considerable portions of writings of Livy. May be taken independently for credit. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Romans Historians—Tacitus
description: Seminar, three hours. Study of considerable portions of writings of Tacitus. May be taken independently for credit. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Ancient Biography: Roman Lives
description: Seminar, three hours. Study of biography in ancient Rome. Literary survey or focused readings on lives of Cornelius Nepos, Suetonius, Tacitus, or imperial chroniclers of 4th century CE. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Roman Novel
description: Seminar, three hours. Works such as Petronius’ Satyricon and Apuleius’ Metamorphoses: study of literary problems. May be repeated for credit with topic change. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Roman Rhetoric
description: Seminar, three hours. Close study of one rhetorical text (e.g., Rhetorica ad Herennium, Cicero’s de Oratore, Seneca’s Controversiae or Suasoriae, Quintilian’s Institutio), with attention to its place in rhetorical tradition. May be repeated for credit with topic change. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Cicero's Orations
description: Seminar, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Cicero's Philosophical Works
description: Lecture, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Cicero: De Natura Deorum
description: Lecture, three hours. Course 221A is not requisite to 221B. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Roman Stoicism
description: Seminar, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Lucretius
description: Lecture, three hours. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seneca
description: Seminar, three hours. Detailed study of one work of prose or poetry by younger Seneca. May be repeated for credit with topic change. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Strengthening Latin
description: Seminar, three hours. Grammar review, vocabulary development, and translation skills practice in reading Latin texts across variety of genres and periods. S/U or letter grading.

title: Seminar: Medieval Latin
description: Seminar, three hours. Preparation: at least one upper-division Latin course. Course 231A is not requisite to 231B. Studies in various areas of language and literature of medieval Latin. May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Seminar: Medieval Latin
description: Seminar, three hours. Preparation: at least one upper-division Latin course. Course 231A is not requisite to 231B. Studies in various areas of language and literature of medieval Latin. May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Vulgar Latin
description: Lecture, three hours. History and characteristics of popular Latin; its development into early forms of Romance languages. S/U or letter grading.

title: Late Latin Poetry
description: Seminar, three hours. Close study, with attention to literary and historical background, of work of one or several poets who flourished between death of Ovid and fall of Roman Empire. May be repeated for credit with change in author. S/U or letter grading.

title: Late Latin Prose
description: Seminar, three hours. Close study, with attention to literary and historical background, of work of one or several prose authors who flourished between death of Tacitus and fall of Roman Empire. May be repeated for credit with change in author. S/U or letter grading.

title: History of Latin Language
description: Lecture, three hours. Development of Latin from earliest monuments until its emergence in Romance languages. S/U or letter grading.

title: Italic Dialects and Latin Historical Grammar
description: Lecture, three hours. Linguistic situation in early Italy. Readings in Oscan, Umbrian, and early Latin texts. Latin grammar in context of Italic and Indo-European linguistics. S/U or letter grading.

title: Seminar: Latin Palaeography
description: Seminar, three hours. Studies in development of book hand in Latin manuscripts earlier than invention of printing. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: Neo-Latin
description: Seminar, three hours. Preparation: at least two upper-division Latin courses. Requisite: course 100. Survey of texts by one or more authors from Renaissance to present, written on related topics. S/U or letter grading.

title: Topical Studies of Ancient Rome
description: Seminar, three hours. Advanced study of some aspect of Latin language or literature or Roman culture. May be repeated for credit with topic change. S/U (2-unit course) or letter (4-unit course) grading.

title: College Teaching of Latin
description: Seminar, to be arranged. Preparation: appointment as teaching assistant. Methodology of instruction in conjunction with classroom practice. May be repeated for credit. S/U grading.

title: Directed Individual Study or Research
description: Tutorial, to be arranged. S/U grading.

title: Study for MA Comprehensive Examination or PhD Qualifying Examinations
description: Tutorial, to be arranged. S/U grading.

title: Research for PhD Dissertation
description: Tutorial, to be arranged. S/U grading.
